result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob P. HETUE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Acquire a diploma or HSED.
The Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing at 09-02-2015 08:30 am
Plea hearing set for 07-14-15 at 3:30 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information adds a Count 5, Possess THC with Intent to Deliver, contrary to Section 961.41(1m)(h)2 of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Not guilty pleas to the charges contained therein.  The matters are placed on the Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-25-15 at 2:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-27-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.

RE:  Deliver THC, on 02-05-15.
Initial appearance is set for 05-18-15 at 2:30 p.m.
